dataObjects.subject: http://www.eol.org/voc/table_of_contents#Wikipedia
dataObjects.title: Denticetopsis seducta
dataObjects.bibliographicCitation: "Denticetopsis seducta." Wikipedia, The Free Encyclopedia. 15 Oct 2012, 17:16 UTC. 15 Mar 2013 <http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Denticetopsis_seducta&oldid=542895524>.
dataObjects.description:
Denticetopsis seducta is a species of whale catfish endemic to Brazil where it has a relatively wide, albeit scattered, distribution in the central and western portions of the Amazon basin and possibly the southwestern portions of the Orinoco River basin; it is relatively disjunct from the other species of Denticetopsis.[1] It grows to a length of 5.1 cm (2.0 inches).

References

  • Froese, Rainer, and Daniel Pauly, eds. (2011). "Denticetopsis seducta" in FishBase. December 2011 version.
  1. ^ Vari, Richard P.; Ferraris, Carl J.; de Pinna, Mário C. C. (2005). "The Neotropical whale catfishes (Siluriformes: Cetopsidae: Cetopsinae), a revisionary study" (PDF). Neotropical Ichthyology 3 (2): 127–238. doi:10.1590/S1679-62252005000200001. http://www.ufrgs.br/ni/vol3num2/Artigo01P127-238lr.pdf.
